Description: Fragment of oval handle from a Thasian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine very micaceous light brown; grey core. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription and Herakles head symbol.
Curator's comments: Names Herophon (lost, Thasian eponym) and Protis (Thasian fabricant). Garlan, Y., Les timbres amphoriques de Thasos. 1, Timbres protothasiens et thasiens anciens (Paris 1999) 369. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 101a, 56.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0009)
